text:
Currently, if you request the Server_Signature variable, it outputs as 
<address>Apache/2.0.43 Server at www.domain.nl Port 80</address>\n
Notice the \n (newline) at the end. This SHOULD NOT be present.

It also questionable if you would want to have <address></address>-tags. This 
is html, and what if your output is plain-text? Also only the latter part is an 
actual address.
creator: info@orangexl.com

text:
The server signature for the 2.0 tree is currently generated in exactly the same
way that it is in the 1.3 tree (\n included). The \n is included so that the
server signature ends up on its own line in the client's output.

If you would like something other than html output, you would need to do some
processing to construct server content that doesn't contain html tags.
creator: rederpj@remulak.net
nd@perlig.de
text:
huh? why not? The server signature is designed for html output and not
standardized in any way. I see no reason why we should change it.

You can build your own plain line, if you want to, by using SERVER_SOFTWARE or
something.
